name: cnvbrabra
body: |- wi(wcel(c0, chba), wceq(cfv(ccnv(cbr), cfv(cbr, c0)), c0))

stmt.origin: mpan(wcel(c0, chba), wceq(cfv(ccnv(cbr), cfv(cbr, c0)), c0), wf1o(cbr, chba, cin(clf, ccnfn)))

body.origin:
|- wi(wcel(c0, chba), wceq(cfv(ccnv(cbr), cfv(cbr, c0)), c0))
-| wf1o(cbr, chba, cin(clf, ccnfn))
-| wi(wa(wf1o(cbr, chba, cin(clf, ccnfn)), wcel(c0, chba)), wceq(cfv(ccnv(cbr), cfv(cbr, c0)), c0))
body.pretty:
⊢ (c0 ∈ ~H →(`' bra `(bra ` c0))= c0)
⊣ (bra : ~H ↔(LinFn ⋂ ContFn))
⊣ (((bra : ~H ↔(LinFn ⋂ ContFn))∧ c0 ∈ ~H)→(`' bra `(bra ` c0))= c0)

comment: The converse bra of the bra of a vector is the vector itself. (Contributed by NM, 30-May-2006.) (New usage is discouraged.)
